title: 'Mangione’s back pain so intense, he couldn't date or get physically intimate'
content: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old accused of murdering a UnitedHealthcare executive, grappled with debilitating chronic back pain. His former landlord revealed Mangione's condition prevented dating and intimacy. Described as a bright engineer, Mangione hid his struggles behind an optimistic facade.
summary: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old accused of murdering a UnitedHealthcare executive, grappled with debilitating chronic back pain. His former landlord revealed Mangione's condition prevented dating and intimacy. Described as a bright engineer, Mangione hid his struggles behind an optimistic facade.

title: Google removes derogatory reviews targeting McDonald's after Luigi Mangione's arrest

'Planned perfect crime, but ... ': What CEO killer got right — and fatally wrong
content: Luigi Mangione, the suspect in the assassination of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, meticulously planned the murder but made careless mistakes. His arrival in NYC 10 days prior was discreet, utilizing cash and fake IDs. However, a brief unmasking, discarded items, and a McDonald's sighting led to his capture.

title: Biden regrets leaving name off pandemic relief checks like Trump did, says he was 'stupid'

Did Mangione’s assassin video game past hint at CEO's murder?
content: Former Ivy League student Luigi Mangione, 26, has been arrested for the murder of United Healthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Mangione, who played the online game "Among Us," was found with a 3D-printed firearm and a manifesto. His online activity post-graduation, including engagement with the Unabomber Manifesto, is under scrutiny as police investigate his motives.
summary: Former Ivy League student Luigi Mangione, 26, has been arrested for the murder of United Healthcare CEO Brian Thompson.  Mangione, who played the online game "Among Us," was found with a 3D-printed firearm and a manifesto. His online activity post-graduation, including engagement with the Unabomber Manifesto, is under scrutiny as police investigate his motives.

title: 'We will respond forcefully': Netanyahu warns Syria's new regime against hosting Iran or arming Hezbollah
content: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu warned Syria's new regime against allowing Iran or Hezbollah to gain influence, threatening forceful action. He confirmed Israeli airstrikes on Syrian military assets and compared them to historical precedents. Netanyahu welcomed Assad's fall as a historic opportunity while also acknowledging the potential dangers and ordering border security reinforcement.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu warned Syria's new regime against allowing Iran or Hezbollah to gain influence, threatening forceful action.  He confirmed Israeli airstrikes on Syrian military assets and compared them to historical precedents.  Netanyahu welcomed Assad's fall as a historic opportunity while also acknowledging the potential dangers and ordering border security reinforcement.

title: Trump names Andrew Ferguson as Federal Trade Commission Chair, pledges antitrust focus on censorship
Israel targets Syria: 480 strikes in 48 hours after Assad’s ouster
content: Israel launched approximately 480 airstrikes in Syria over two days, targeting military installations after the removal of President Assad. The IDF aimed to prevent strategic weapons from reaching terrorist groups, striking airfields, naval vessels, and weapons production sites. Israeli leaders view Assad's ouster as a regional turning point but express concern about potential extremist threats.
summary: Israel launched approximately 480 airstrikes in Syria over two days, targeting military installations after the removal of President Assad.  The IDF aimed to prevent strategic weapons from reaching terrorist groups, striking airfields, naval vessels, and weapons production sites.  Israeli leaders view Assad's ouster as a regional turning point but express concern about potential extremist threats.

title: Pak ex-ISI chief indicted on charges of treason, graft, misuse of authority
content: Former Pakistani intelligence chief Lt. Gen. Faiz Hameed (Retd) faces court-martial charges, including political activity, violating official secrets act, and jeopardizing state security. His alleged role in the May 9 unrest, linked to Imran Khan's arrest, is under investigation. Hameed's close ties with Khan and prior disputes with the former army chief add complexity to the situation.
summary: Former Pakistani intelligence chief Lt. Gen. Faiz Hameed (Retd) faces court-martial charges, including political activity, violating official secrets act, and jeopardizing state security.  His alleged role in the May 9 unrest, linked to Imran Khan's arrest, is under investigation. Hameed's close ties with Khan and prior disputes with the former army chief add complexity to the situation.

title: Suspect held for UnitedHealthcare CEO's murder an Ivy League grad, saw self as hero
content: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old with an impressive academic and professional background, has been arrested for the assassination of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Police discovered a manifesto denouncing the healthcare industry, a weapon, and fake ID on Mangione. He vanished six months prior, ending communication with family and friends after a back injury.
summary: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old with an impressive academic and professional background, has been arrested for the assassination of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Police discovered a manifesto denouncing the healthcare industry, a weapon, and fake ID on Mangione. He vanished six months prior, ending communication with family and friends after a back injury.

title: Israel says it destroyed Syria's navy in overnight air strikes
content: Israel launched airstrikes, destroying Syria's navy. Ground forces entered Syria for the first time in 50 years. Israel claims the actions are defensive. They aim to prevent threats and create a buffer zone. The strikes follow the fall of President Assad. Israel warns Syrian rebels against following Assad's path.
summary: Israel launched airstrikes, destroying Syria's navy.  Ground forces entered Syria for the first time in 50 years.  Israel claims the actions are defensive.  They aim to prevent threats and create a buffer zone.  The strikes follow the fall of President Assad.  Israel warns Syrian rebels against following Assad's path.

title: UK criminology student kills to satisfy curiosity, claims knife fascination
content: A 20-year-old criminology student, Nasen Saadi, is on trial for the murder of Amie Gray and the attempted murder of Leanne Miles on a Bournemouth beach. Saadi, who had researched weapons and expressed a morbid curiosity about taking a life, allegedly stabbed the women as they sat by a fire. He has pleaded not guilty to the charges.
summary: A 20-year-old criminology student, Nasen Saadi, is on trial for the murder of Amie Gray and the attempted murder of Leanne Miles on a Bournemouth beach.  Saadi, who had researched weapons and expressed a morbid curiosity about taking a life, allegedly stabbed the women as they sat by a fire. He has pleaded not guilty to the charges.

title: DOJ secretly seized phone records of Trump’s FBI pick Kash Patel: Report
content: Kash Patel, a close advisor to Donald Trump and his potential FBI director pick, faces scrutiny after revelations of a Trump-era DOJ seizure of his phone records during leak investigations. Patel's central role in these investigations, including targeting journalists and political rivals, raises concerns about potential partisan influence and retaliation if he leads the FBI.
summary: Kash Patel, a close advisor to Donald Trump and his potential FBI director pick, faces scrutiny after revelations of a Trump-era DOJ seizure of his phone records during leak investigations.  Patel's central role in these investigations, including targeting journalists and political rivals, raises concerns about potential partisan influence and retaliation if he leads the FBI.

title: ‘What?’: Prince Harry confronts wild rumours about Meghan and his US life
content: Prince Harry addressed rumors of marital discord with Meghan Markle, joking about the persistent speculation surrounding their relationship and alleged moves. Speaking at the New York Times DealBook Summit, he expressed contentment with their life in the US, reflecting on it as the life his mother envisioned for him.

title: UnitedHealthcare CEO murder: Suspect Luigi Mangione’s family and friends react to arrest
content: Ivy League graduate Luigi Mangione, 26, was arrested in Pennsylvania for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. The shocking incident occurred outside a Manhattan hotel. Mangione's family expressed devastation and offered prayers for the Thompson family. Friends described him as brilliant and unassuming, struggling to reconcile the allegations with the person they knew.
summary: Ivy League graduate Luigi Mangione, 26, was arrested in Pennsylvania for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. The shocking incident occurred outside a Manhattan hotel. Mangione's family expressed devastation and offered prayers for the Thompson family. Friends described him as brilliant and unassuming, struggling to reconcile the allegations with the person they knew.

title: Malibu Fire: Thousands evacuated as blaze continues to expand, destroying structures
content: A fast-moving wildfire, the Franklin Fire, erupted in Malibu, California, forcing thousands to evacuate and threatening numerous structures. Driven by strong Santa Ana winds, the fire quickly spread across over 2,200 acres. Firefighters battled the blaze, hampered by extreme winds, while Pepperdine University and surrounding areas faced significant threats.
summary: A fast-moving wildfire, the Franklin Fire, erupted in Malibu, California, forcing thousands to evacuate and threatening numerous structures. Driven by strong Santa Ana winds, the fire quickly spread across over 2,200 acres. Firefighters battled the blaze, hampered by extreme winds, while Pepperdine University and surrounding areas faced significant threats.

title: Luigi Mangione shouts as he's brought for extradition hearing: 'It's an insult...'
content: It's extremely out of touch and an insult to the intelligence of the American people and the lived experience," he said as he was led into a Pennsylvania courthouse. Dressed in an orange prison jumpsuit, Luigi was seen screaming to send out his message. He will have to be transferred to New York City where he coldbloodedly shot Thompson dead.

Dressed in an orange prison jumpsuit, Luigi was seen screaming to send out his message. He will have to be transferred to New York City where he coldbloodedly shot Thompson dead.

title: Luigi Mangione's first meal behind bars revealed: A square slice of pizza
content: Luigi Mangione calmed down at the police station when officers shared with him a square slice of pizza which was his first meal after his arrest. The police released new footage of the 26-year-old suspected killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in which he was seen having a hash brown at McDonald's minutes before he was arrested.
